main event: Multiple witnesses observed a spherical, disk-like object, approximately 12 inches in diameter, moving at a speed faster than any known jet aircraft over Lake Charles Air Force Base in 1952 for about 7 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed from the ground using naked eye, with no sound heard and no visible exhaust.
It was estimated to be at an altitude of 5000 feet and at a distance of approximately 3000 feet from the observer.
The object changed its direction multiple times, moving from north to south, then heading due west.
There was no physical evidence such as fragments or photographs found at the sighting location.
The evaluation of the report was deemed 'poor' due to insufficient data for evaluation and the maximums negating the possibility of a balloon.
location: Lake Charles Air Force Base, Lake Charles, Louisiana
